text: That trend is obviously crazy. Gamestop does have atleast one chance of scrapping along, that being that many gamers like physical disks for the ability to resell them when done and/or buy games cheaper on the secondary market, all of which gamestop enables. There could be enough meat on the bone there to keep scraping by

But the cheaper versions of consoles don't have a disk slot, so that market will wane. There's not going to be much reason for it to exist so they should probably try to get out of leases as soon as possible and just do online store stuff to save their investor's money.

Imagine the day Sony allows trading digital copies of games for a €20 fee or something.
